name: Alexander Krull
content: Dr Alexander Krull - School of Computer Science - University of Birmingham Dr Alexander Krull School of Computer ScienceAssistant Professor of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Contact details Emaila.f.f.krull@bham.ac.uk View my research portal AddressUniversity of Birmingham Edgbaston Birmingham B15 2TT UK Dr. Alexander Krull is Assistant Professor in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence at the University of Birmingham's School of Computer Science. He is a member of COMPARE. His research focuses on developing advanced methods for image analysis and denoising, particularly for microscopy applications. Dr. Krull is a pioneer in establishing self-supervised and unsupervised denoising methods that do not require clean reference images for training.  Notably, he introduced Noise2Void, a self-supervised approach that enables denoising from unpaired noisy images without the need for clean targets. In more recent research, Dr. Krull works on utilising generative image models for unsupervised denoising, leading to approaches such as  GAP (Generative Accumulation of Photons) and COSDD (COrrelated and Signal-Dependent Denoising), which are capable of accounting the inherent uncertainty of the denoising problem. Dr. Krull’s contributions have been widely utilised in the life science community. His work has significantly advanced the application of deep learning techniques in biomedical imaging.
